SEARCH
Package model

Class BoardGames

java.lang.Object
model.Toy
model.BoardGames
public class BoardGames extends Toy
Represents a Board Game toy with a player range and a list of designers. Extends the Toy superclass and includes additional attributes specific to board games.
Version:
3.0
Author:
Justin, Fatema, Manveet

  • Constructor Details

    • BoardGames

      public BoardGames(String sn, String name, String brand, double price, int availableCount, int ageAppropriate, int minPlayers, int maxPlayers, String designer)
      Constructs a Board Game with the specified attributes.
      Parameters:
      sn - Unique serial number; must start with 7, 8, or 9 and be 10 digits.
      name - Name of the board game.
      brand - Brand of the board game.
      price - Price of the board game; must be non-negative.
      availableCount - Stock count for the board game.
      ageAppropriate - Minimum age appropriate for the board game.
      minPlayers - Minimum number of players for the game.
      maxPlayers - Maximum number of players for the game.
      designer - A comma-separated string of designer names.

  • Method Details

    • getMinPlayers

      public int getMinPlayers()
      Gets the minimum number of players for the board game.
      Returns:
      the minimum number of players as an integer.

    • getMaxPlayers

      public int getMaxPlayers()
      Gets the maximum number of players for the board game.
      Returns:
      the maximum number of players as an integer.

    • getDesigners

      public String[] getDesigners()
      Gets the list of designers for the board game.
      Returns:
      an array of designer names.

    • setDesigners

      public void setDesigners(String[] designers)
      Sets the list of designers for the board game.
      Parameters:
      designers - an array of designer names.

    • getToyType

      public String getToyType()
      Returns the toy type as "BoardGame".
      Specified by:
      getToyType in class Toy
      Returns:
      a string indicating the toy type as "BoardGame".

    • toDataString

      public String toDataString()
      Returns a string formatted for saving the board game toy's data to a file. The format is compatible with the `toys.txt` file and includes all relevant details about the toy, separated by semicolons.
      Specified by:
      toDataString in class Toy
      Returns:
      a string representation of the toy's data for file storage.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a formatted string representing the board game’s details, including minimum and maximum players and designers. This format is designed to be useful for displaying board game-specific details in addition to the general toy information.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Toy
      Returns:
      A string representation of the board game's details in the format: "Category: [Toy Type], Serial Number: [SN], Name: [Name], Price: [Price], Available Count: [Count], Age Appropriate: [Age], Players: [Min-Max], Designers: [Designers]"
